result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason S Gorton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: The Court withholds sentence and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.

miscConds.notes:
--to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge

--summons fees of $66
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to undergo mental health evaluation assessment and follow through as deemed appropriate by the Agent

--submit DNA sample to designee upon demand

-- If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

ARRESTING AGENCY: Jefferson County Child Support Agency

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

[JK] case called at 11:14am
Defendant Jason S Gorton in court with Attorney Elizabeth  Svehlek. ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Svehlek states that Mr Gorton has a pending Social Security claim and are waiting for him to have the final hearing scheduled where he would be adjuducated. He does not have this date yet. Attorney Svehlek does not have any other medical records to submit at this time. She would like to keep the Jury Trial dates in April.
The Court will leave the matter scheduled as is, and the Court intends to address the motion to impeach and notice to admit stateements along with any brief motions.
The Court reminds Mr Gorton that the final opportunity to resolve case is on the FSSC date.
The Bond and its conditions remain in effect as long as the case is pending.
recess: 11:20am

NEXT:  The 3/28/17 FSSC and the the 4/3/17-4/4/17 Jury Trial remain on the Courts calendar.
Motion hearing on March 28, 2017 at 10:30 am.
STATE'S NOTICE OF INTENT TO ADMIT STATEMENTS MADE BY THE DEFENDANT
STATE'S NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO IMPEACH THE DEFENDANT WITH PRIOR CONVICTIONS/ADJUDICATIONS
Scheduling Order
Jury trial on April 3/4, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on March 28, 2017 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on March 2, 2017 at 11:15 am.

Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV: 
[MK] case called at 2:40pm
Defendant Jason S Gorton in court with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Svehlek acknowledges that there have been similar requests from the Defense however she is requesting that another status conference be scheduled. Attorney Svehlek is continuing to pursue an affirmative defense.  Attorney Svehlek notes that Mr. Gorton's pending application for disability includes that claim that Mr. Gorton was disabled and unable to work during the subject dates of violation period of May to December 2014.  Mr. Gorton has received confirmation that he has been approved for a disability-related hearing , however no date certain for the hearing before the Social Security Administration authorities has been given. 
The Court schedules another Status Conference. However on request of DA Happ the Court also schedules the case for Jury Trial. 
The Court indicates that Bail remains as fixed.
recess 2:45pm.  
reconvene 2:54pm.
Attorney Svehlek provides the Defendant's new address in Milwaukee:  1426 S. 31st Street, Milwaukee WI 53215
recess 2:54pm.

NEXT:  (1) Status Conference on 3/2/17 at 11:15am,   (2) FSSC 3/28/17 at 10:30am  and (3) Jury Trial on 4/3-4/4/17 at 8:30am

[MK] case called at 10:26am.
Defendant Jason S Gorton in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Gorton waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--plea of "not guilty" is entered
Attorney Svehlek requests the scheduling of a Status Conference in approximately thirty days; this will allow her further time to seek Social Security records in relation to a possible affirmative defense. There has been a delay with this because Attorney Svehlek has learned that the request for records that she sent to the Social Security Office now needs to be mailed to a different location. 
recess 10:29am.
[Post Hearing/Off Record Mr. Gorton verifies that the S. 14th Street address is current.]

NEXT:   Status Conference on 9/30/16 at 2:30pm.

from Attorney Svehlek requesting that the Defendant be allowed to appear by telephone

Case called at 9:00am [mo]
Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek in court.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant, Jason Gorton does NOT appear.

The Court informs parties that Mr. Gorton called the Clerk of Courts office indicating that his car broke down on the interstate, he was with a State Trooper, but it did not seem likely that he would be able to get to court today.

With no objection from ADA Shock, the Court reschedules todays hearing for next Friday, 8/5/16 at 10:45am for a Waiver of Preliminary Hearing, as Atty. Svehlek has indicated it will be a waiver. 
recess: 9:02am

NEXT: Waiver of Preliminary Hearing on 8/5/16 at 10:45am

[MK] case called at 1:35pm. 
Defendant Jason S. Gorton appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Mr. Gorton verifies that the date of birth on the Criminal Complaint is correct. An updated address is provided. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2500  signature bond, with no special conditions:
recess 1:37 pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 4/20/16 at 11:00am  (2) Status Conference on 6/21/16 at 8:30am
